algorithm_technique: Sort rectangles by x or y coordinates and check for valid cut points.
Greedy approach with sorting and interval checking.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if an n x n grid can be divided into three sections by two cuts (horizontal or vertical) such that each section has at least one rectangle.
problem_summary_technical: Sort rectangles by x or y, then check if two cuts can partition them into three non-empty groups.
key_insights: The problem can be solved by considering horizontal and vertical cuts separately.
Sorting the rectangles based on the cut dimension is crucial.
The core idea is to find two cut positions that divide the rectangles into three distinct groups.
